Dialogue: Where are we going? Jay looks at him a beat.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Omaha. And I'm gonna buy you the biggest T-bone you ever saw when we get there. So -- you head over to the Omaha tube and I'm gonna help these guys over here for a second. But I'll meet you in a minute. By the Omaha tube. They stare at each other --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Sounds good. See you there. Kay turns to head off -- then, lightening fast, spins and reaches into Jay's pocket, snatches out the card --

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: No, no, no. No way. Florida, Kay.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: That's what it says.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Don't you get it?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Yeah, it's hot and muggy. The old people drive slow.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: This is why you were there. In Florida. Because of them. You were helping them and that's why... that's why you get killed. Today, July 16. I saw the report myself. Agent Kay, dead at the scene. Killed by Yaz.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You know what an MiB agent calls it when he faces death? Besides I got you to watch my back, right? They walk to the FLORIDA TUBE

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I just want you to know, I'm doing this out of love, man.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Doing what? He gets his answer -- Jay DECKS HIM.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You stay home and stay alive. But Kay isn't down.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I told them I'd help them -- I'm honor-bound to do it. Kay throws a DIRTY SUCKER-PUNCH to Jay's kidney. Jay recovers and throws an UPPERCUT to Kay's solar plexus. Jay winces -- like he just hit something hard.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Damn, you used to have some abs. They continue to pound each other. As they trade punches:

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I make my own future! Besides -- I'm younger and stronger than you!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Bet you're sorry you taught me that. The fight continues... They're wearing down, circling each other... And then Kay fakes a left ---

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Had enough yet? On Jay -- gasping, spent -- using every last reserve of strength to lift himself off that floor.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I can't let you go -- I love you! Jay KICKS KAY SAVAGELY IN THE GROIN. Kay LUNGES AT JAY. They CLINCH... it's a stalemate...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Aw, hell, look at that-- behind you-

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I'm not falling for that.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I'm not kidding -- Kay rotates their clinch towards the tube so Jay can see... The ARCHANANS -- very cheerfully, benignly hopping into the

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: (yelling over the wind

Speaker: lama
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Oh. Okay, then. Thanks, good to hear.

Speaker: lama
Dialogue: But where there was death, there will be death.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: What does that mean? The Lama smiles and zips ahead through the current. Jay gets CLOBBERED by a bend in the tube.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: De-tube?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Helmet? No one said anything about

Speaker: alpha manatee
Dialogue: Sorry, I have something in my throat. They went that way...

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Thanks. Surrounded by thick brush, trees. Jay staggers out of the water, looking beat to hell.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Okay. So we've got... 30 minutes to get past security. Get into Mission Control. Reprogram the flight path, pull the Astronauts off the launch and get them in that rocket.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Well, then. Better get started.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Weird. I feel like I've been here.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Move and it's the last thing you do! The security is on Kay and the Archanans, forcing them down. Kay gives Jay a look --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Good work. It's like we're not even here.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: You've got it wrong, let me explain-

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Shut up! Anything you have to say, you can say to my superior officer! And boy does he hate your kind... A click... click... click... Someone is approaching. Someone who walks like they mean business.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Finally, someone I can talk to-- But the Colonel is on him before you can blink, an equal- opportunity hardass to the extreme:

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: The only thing we're gonna talk about is what specific breed of dumbass you have to be to try to penetrate my launch site! He begins patting Jay down. Eyes widen --

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: Weapon! You are going away for a long time...  Get them into holding. We'll interrogate them after the launch. A beat... and Jay goes for it:

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Sir, before you do that --- my name is Agent Jay. I appreciate your position, but I'm from a top-secret government agency in charge of protecting the world from the scum of the universe and right now, on behalf of the people of Earth, I.: need to commandeer your rocket so

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: So you want us to stop the most massive endeavor in American history, an event being watched by the entire world, the moment that will be the culmination of a challenge put to us by President John F. Kennedy himself... so a bunch of Hare Krishnas can take a joy ride?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Would it help if I told you I'm from the future?

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: Get them out of here! He motions to the other MPs, who move to roust the group... But the Lama takes the Colonel by the arm--

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Sir?

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Yes, sir... The Colonel turns to Jay, Kay and the Archanans:

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: The rest of you, come with me. The Colonel heads into the building. They follow.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Things change when you can see the future, right?

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: They sure do. This is definitely about some next-level shit. The PA crackles:

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: A hive of activity leading up to the launch.. Miles and miles of white guys in buzzcuts and shortsleeve button-down shirts. Thick glasses, slide rules, pocket protectors -- a sea of IBM men. Everyone smoking, RUSHING AROUND, LAST-MINUTE CHAOS... Hunkered over computer monitors... reel-to-reel data tapes spinning. Less computing power than an iPhone, but we put a man on the moon.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Attention, everyone! We've got a change in plans! Everyone's consumed with the launch and wearing headsets -- they ignore him -- he keeps trying --

Speaker: engineer
Dialogue: You see this card? The rocket's flight path is all on cards just like this one. Right here -- He indicates a long metal rack, like a mail-sorting machine, that holds many 1000s of cards and feeds them into a processor. An Archanan approaches and BLOWS ON THE CARDS -- it hits the cards like a mini-whirlwind. The cards spiral everywhere like bats pouring out of a cave -- chads fly off -- they're magically re-programmed! And fly back into the rack. The engineers are STUNNED. And then PANIC:

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Slow down there! Everyone be cool!

Speaker: engineer
Dialogue: Coolness is an inappropriate response! The Engineer flips the SAFETY off a red button marked "ABORT"

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: No! Stop! Do not abort!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: What's that? You been holding out on me?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Little something I've been working on. Glasses if you've got 'em. Jay and Kay put on their glasses...

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Ha ha, just like old times...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Oh, and you might want to get under a desk.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Get under a--?

Speaker: engineer
Dialogue: One! The engineers hand comes down... but before he can hit the

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: What the hell was that??

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: It's a high-velocity non-lethal pellet-gun. The boys in the lab call it the "hiv-nol-pog."

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Catchy. The Archanans deftly step out of the way -- or the pellets swerve around them. EX RUNS IN, flanked by security and/or MiB agents.

Speaker: ex
Dialogue: It's Kay! There he is! Take him down! Shoot him if you have to! EX catches a PELLET TO THE GROIN, crumples. The pellets settle... quiet...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: What a waste.

Speaker: engineer
Dialogue: Raquel Welch was here?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Five minutes to get to the rocket. And keep your eyes open for Yaz. They head out.

Speaker: buzz aldrin
Dialogue: What in Sam Hill is going on? Reveal the Jeep, pulled in front of the Astronauts, cutting them off.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: No disrespect meant, [major]. I'm a big fan.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: But we've got some bigger fish to fry. Hand over the flight suits. They start pulling the astronauts off the truck. The astronauts protest.

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: That's right, gentlemen. You need to listen to them. We're going to protocol twelve. The astronauts acquiesce.

Speaker: buzz aldrin
Dialogue: I didn't want to get in that death trap anyways.

Speaker: neil armstrong
Dialogue: I'm still getting my parade, right?

Speaker: yaz
Dialogue: I want in. The guards look at each other --

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Should we radio the Colonel?

Speaker: launch platform
Dialogue: Kay loads the Archanans into the capsule., Technicians in clean suits assist.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: We good yet, Kay? I don't like being out here in the open -- too many ways for Yaz to get to you...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I'm almost there. Kay's got them inside, but having problems with the hatch.

Speaker: tech
Dialogue: It's called-a hatch.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Whatever, just get over here.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Oh, come on -- what's going on?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: This door is complicated.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Oh, for...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: What? It's an Apollo rocket, not a Plymouth Valiant, OK? It's complicated. Jay goes over to help Kay with the door. They both fuss and fight over the door.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Lift it. You have to lift it.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: No, I am lifting it. You have to hold the lever.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: No, if I hold the lever, the rubber thingie won't... go in the thing where the thingie goes... Kay notices something in the reflection of the hatch glass.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Jay... Why do you think a highly trained NASA technician would leave the back of his suit unzipped? They exchange a look that parallels the opening scene in the Chinese restaurant...

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Because it's about to go down. They turn around, draw weapons on the tech -- it's YAZ!

Speaker: yaz
Dialogue: You can't stop me! Nothing on Earth can stop me!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Nothing now. Yaz raises an eyebrow...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Little something I brought with me. Jay points the gun at Yaz -- but Yaz just LAUGHS --

Speaker: yaz
Dialogue: Try it! You wouldn't dare! One false shot and you'll rip space and time!

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: That's a chance I'll have to take. Jay BLASTS YAZ Yaz stumbles BACK INTO THE CAPSULE... The hatch SLAMS him in! Just as the ROCKET BEGINS LIFTOFF--

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Uh oh -- But the Archanans surround them with their aura -- where the flames and smoke flow harmlessly around them... And then it's over...

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: We did it, partner. I hope you remember this when you recruit me -- you won't give me such a hard time.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You know I will.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I guess we'll have to build a prison on the moon or something. Jay realizes -- grabs Kay --

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Do a better job this time, OK? That needs to be one hell of a prison. You don't want that guy coming back, or I'm coming back. Look, once was enough, OK? Jay turns to The Colonel --

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: Not too worried about that.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Can I ask you -- what did the Lama show you in there that made you help us? Was it the Earth being destroyed?

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: No -- it was my son. All grown up. As a matter of fact, I'm late to see him -- I promised I'd watch the launch with him.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Oh. Thanks. He's a lucky kid.

Speaker: colonel
Dialogue: I'm a lucky dad. Take care. Jay offers him a handshake. The officer takes it -- and pulls Jay into a hug.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Okay... The Colonel leaves. Jay and Kay congratulate each other, smile over a job well done... But then they see the Archanans... And realize...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: We're sorry we didn't get you home, guys. It was the only way to get rid of Yaz.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: But we'll make sure you're safe here. And the next rocket out...

Speaker: lama
Dialogue: All is well. You have done well.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: No we didn't. You wanted to go home...

Speaker: lama
Dialogue: There is what we desire and what must be... And now our gift to you...

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Gift? But we didn't get you home.

Speaker: archanans
Dialogue: There is the action and there is the intention. It is the intention we reward.

Speaker: lama
Dialogue: You did the right thing. And if humans are capable of such sacrifice, such friendship... perhaps we ARE already home.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: So then what's the gift?

Speaker: lama
Dialogue: You already have it. Jay looks at pong.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: This? Pong?

Speaker: lama
Dialogue: Yes. PONG. The Pan-Galactic Ordnance Negation Grid. Agent Kay will use this technology...

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: To make the missile defense system. You use this to save the world.

Speaker: archanans
Dialogue: Yes. Don't drop it. They take the PONG and drape it around Kay's neck The Archanans leave, chanting...

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Hey. My watch stopped. We see -- a minute to go. Jay looks at the watch. Something about it bothers him...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: C'mon. Let's go watch that bastard leave the atmosphere.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Yeah, I'll catch up with you in a second.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: So you guys understand all this time stuff, right? So is everything going to be okay now? I mean, if I saved everything, and Yaz is really gone, why am I even here? Shouldn't I not have come in the first place? And why do I still have time left on my watch?

Speaker: underground
Dialogue: The scaffolding leads Jay and the Archanans into the maze of underground hallways. Jay walks, looking at his watch, thinking...

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: 3:59. But Kay didn't get killed until... And then the AWFUL REALIZATION --

Speaker: with kay
Dialogue: Unaware that his appointment with death is near...

Speaker: with jay
Dialogue: Running... running... searching... where is Kay?

Speaker: with jay
Dialogue: Running... more frantic now... And then he sees him! Kay -- at the end of the hallway!. Backlit by the door to the outside...

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Kay! And then Jay sees -- Yazl Already there! Jay goes for his weapon, but he doesn't have the shot! Yaz pulls his guns...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: See? I knew you had my back. Jay hears footsteps. Looks up and sees the SHADOW OF A TALL

Speaker: kid's voice
Dialogue: Dad? What's going on? The kid steps into the light -- backlit -- but from the shape of his head and Jay's reaction, this kid could only be YOUNG

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Where there is death, there will always be death. He saved your life. He swapped his for yours. He saved the world. Kay puts a firm hand on Jay --

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: I'll take it from here. Kay steps away... but turns back. In a replay of the moment from the first movie, Jay tosses Kay a modern Neuralizer.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Leave me some memories this time,

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Sure, partner. I'll see you around.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Yes you will. Kay turns back to the boy, takes his hand. Jay watches them from a distance: Kay takes something off the ground where The Colonel's body was -- hands it to the son.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Hey, look -- your Dad wanted you to have this. Kay gives the kid a shiny new commemorative Apollo key chain. Jay looks in his pocket -- the same key chain, scratched and worn.

Speaker: young jay
Dialogue: Where is he?

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Your daddy had to go -- he's part of the space program, now. He's okay, he just had to take a trip up to the stars, but you'll be just fine. I'll keep an eye on you... They are silhouetted by the bright light of the Apollo launch... Jay takes out his iPhone and ALL GOES WHITE...

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Noo!!!! And then... A giant PONG PADDLE rises over the horizon and

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: It's good to see you, man. He gives him a hug-- gets a "what the hell?" face.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Alright, everyone, give me and my partner here a minute. They leave the guys alone. A beat -- and Jay just wraps him in THE BIGGEST HUG EVER.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: It's good to see you, man. So good. I just... do you remember... I mean, do you know what I've been through? Kay just stares at him.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You mean, do I remember that you travelled back in time to save my life and the world? Not bad, slick. Not bad.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: No problem. You'd do the same for me. I just have one question...

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Well, I don't know exactly. Because I was dead. But in a quantum reality, objects can exist in contradictory states... So multiple timelines with varying probabilities can exist, and the one you're closest to

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Oh, you're talking about our closeness... you're talking about our love... Across timelines! You're saying our love will go on! Kay swats him away -- but the love couldn't be more clear. Jay feels something in his pocket -- the keychain. Takes it out.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Yes he was.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I'm glad I know that.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: So you travelled back in time, huh?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Yep.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Wow. And you didn't change anything?

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: You're sure? Because the littlest thing can have huge repercussions.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: I was very careful.

Speaker: kay
Dialogue: Good man, good man. Well, let's get you a uniform.

Speaker: jay
Dialogue: Excuse me? We PULL BACK -- Revealing PRESENT DAY MIB IN ALL ITS KICKASS GRANDEUR. Eternally vigilant in the struggle to protect the Earth and all its inhabitants... And every one of those agents wearing BLUE SUITS WITH SHORTS.
